description: United States National CAD Standard (NCS) callout detection prompts

detail.name: Detail Callout
detail.text_prompt: A small detail indicator symbol per NCS 01 42 00-020. MUST be a circle (or rectangle/hexagon) with a HORIZONTAL DIVIDING LINE through the middle. The horizontal line is the KEY DISTINGUISHING FEATURE. Symbol diameter/width is small and compact: 0.3-0.8 inches (20-60 pixels at 150 DPI). Inside the circle is a simple alphanumeric identifier (like '3', 'D2', '15') ABOVE the horizontal dividing line, with an optional sheet reference BELOW the line (format: 'A-201', 'S4.1', 'A-512'). CRITICAL: The symbol has NO TRIANGLES - if it has a triangle, it's an elevation callout, NOT a detail callout. The horizontal divider line separates the detail number from the sheet reference, appearing like a fraction. May have a thin leader line or arrow pointing to the detail location. Appears on plan views to reference enlarged details. Size constraint: bounding box should be compact (20-60 pixels width/height), NOT large text areas or dimension annotations.
visual_characteristics: Circle, rectangle, or hexagon outline
MUST have horizontal dividing line through middle (KEY FEATURE)
NO triangles (triangles indicate elevation callouts)
Detail identifier ABOVE horizontal line
Sheet reference BELOW horizontal line (A-201, S4.1, A-512 format)
Appears like a fraction: 'D2' over 'A-512'
May have thin leader line or diagonal arrow
Compact size (20-60 pixels at 150 DPI)
false_positives_to_exclude: Plain circles WITHOUT horizontal divider (slab types, grid markers, room numbers)
Circles with only single alphanumeric (like 'S6', '7', 'B') - these are slab/grid markers
Text annotations (NORTH, SCALE, NOTE, TYP, EQ)

elevation.name: Elevation Callout
elevation.text_prompt: A compact elevation indicator symbol with a solid black triangle pointing in the viewing direction. The symbol is small (0.3-0.8 inches, 20-60 pixels at 150 DPI). Two types exist: Type 1 is a solid triangle with text near its base showing detail number and sheet reference separated by '/'. Type 2 is a circle with a triangle attached where the triangle points stick out from the circle edge; inside the circle is a horizontal line with detail number above and sheet reference below (like a fraction). CRITICAL distinguishing feature: MUST have a visible solid triangle. If no triangle is present, it is NOT an elevation - it's a different callout type. The triangle is the key identifier. Compact size, not large areas. May have a thin leader line pointing to the elevation location. Format examples: '2/A-201', 'A4' over 'A-201'.
visual_characteristics: MUST have a solid black triangle (key identifier)
Triangle points in viewing direction
Compact size (0.3-0.8 inches, 20-60 pixels at 150 DPI)
Type 1: Triangle only with '/' separator for detail/sheet number
Type 2: Circle with triangle points sticking out, horizontal line inside (fraction format)
Detail number and sheet reference (e.g., '2/A-201', 'A4' over 'A-201')
May have thin leader line
false_positives_to_exclude: Section indicators with cutting plane lines

section.name: Section Callout
section.text_prompt: A section indicator symbol per NCS 01 42 00-077/078. Consists of a solid circle (12.7mm or 1/2 inch diameter) attached to a cutting plane line (break line showing where the section cut occurs). Circle has thin black outline, white fill, and horizontal dividing line. Contains a section identifier (letter or alphanumeric like 'B3', 'A2') above the line, with sheet reference below in format 'B3/A-303' or 'A2/S-401'. The circle is positioned at the end of the cutting plane line and shows the direction from which to view the section. The cutting plane line itself is a break line that cuts through the building/object. Based on US NCS standard 01 42 00-077/078. Sheet references follow NCS discipline+number format (A-303, S-401, etc.).
visual_characteristics: Solid circular outline (12.7mm/1/2 inch diameter)
Horizontal dividing line inside circle
Attached to cutting plane line (break line with section cut)
Section identifier above line (B3, A2, etc.)
Sheet reference below line (A-303, S-401 format)
Circle shows viewing direction for the section
Based on NCS 01 42 00-077/078
false_positives_to_exclude: Plain detail circles without cutting plane lines

title.name: Title Callout
title.text_prompt: A very small circular callout symbol, much smaller than regular detail callouts. Circle diameter is only 0.2-0.4 inches (15-35 pixels at 150 DPI). Appears INSIDE or immediately adjacent to an enlarged detail drawing box boundary, typically at the top-left or bottom-left corner of that detail box. Contains only a simple reference number (1-9) or letter (A-Z) that matches a detail callout on the main plan. The circle is thin-outlined, standalone, and compact. CRITICAL: This is NOT the large sheet title block with drawing name and sheet number - those are much larger rectangular areas. This is a tiny circle marker within individual detail enlargements. Size constraint: bounding box must be very small (15-35 pixels), NOT large title blocks or text areas exceeding 100 pixels in any dimension.
visual_characteristics: Small circular outline
Located at bottom/corner of detail drawing boxes
Contains reference number or letter matching detail callout
Usually near text labels (detail name, scale)
Smaller than typical plan callouts (0.25-0.5 inches)
false_positives_to_exclude: Detail callouts on main plan view

exclude_rules: Any circle containing only words with 3+ consecutive letters
Circles with dimension text (measurements with fractions or units like 2-1/2", 16'-0")
Grid reference markers (single letters along grid lines)
Circles without clear geometric precision (freehand drawn)
